bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.p: STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING. SS.
MIKE RUBENSTEIN, being first duly sworn on oath, deposed and says:

That he is one of the signers of the foregoing bond in the case of the alien M. Aloshin; that he resides at 1223 Yesler Way, in the City of Seattle, Washington, and that the value of his property exempt from levy and sale upon execution is over One Thousand Dollars ($1000.00), to-wit, real estate in the County of Pierce, State of Washington, described as follows to-wit, beginning at the point 208 1/2 feet West of the North East Corner of the North West One-quarter of the North-East one quarter of the North-West one- quarter of Section thirty five, Twp. twenty one, North Range 1.W.W.M., running thence South 417 feet, thence East 28 1/2 feet, thence South 91 feet, thence West 287 feet, thence North 299 1/2 feet, thence East 15 1/2 feet, thence North 208 1/2 feet, thence East 243 feet to point of beginning and containing three acres more or less, and at the present fair market value of said property is about Two Thousand Dollars ($2,000.00), and one Grocery Store, located at 1223 Yesler, in the City of Seattle, State of Washington, together with the fixtures and stock valued about at One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00); that he is now liable upon no other bond, obligation, recognizance, either as principal or surety, except as hereinafter stated. Deponent further says, that he is of full age and under no disability to execute the foregoing bond.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24th day of March 1914
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
